1// devela::sys::env::app
2//
3//! Defines [`AppConfig`], [`AppEnv`], [`AppApple`], [`AppUnix`], [`AppWindows`] and [`AppXdg`].
4//
5// TODO:
6// - add more docs and examples.
7//   - https://github.com/lunacookies/etcetera/pull/22/files
8// - add more Xdg directories.
9//   - https://github.com/lunacookies/etcetera/pull/16/files
10//   - WAIT: [XDG_BIN_HOME](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xdg/xdg-specs/-/issues/14)
11// - add environment specific validations.
12//   - android app name 30 char max.
13//   - apple bundle_id 155 char max, app_name 50 char max.
14//   - windows server 36 char max.
15
16use crate::{Env, Path, PathBuf, is};
17
18/// Application specific metadata.
19///
20/// It is used together with [`AppEnv`].
21#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq)]
22pub struct AppConfig {
23    tld: String,
24    author: String,
25    app_name: String,
26}
27impl AppConfig {
28    /// Creates a new `AppConfig` if all fields are valid.
29    ///
30    /// In order to be valid, they can't be empty, and:
31    /// - <abbr title = "Top Level Domain">`tld`</abbr>:
32    ///   up to 127 lowercase alphanumeric characters and dots (`^[a-z0-9\.]+$`).
33    /// - `author`:
34    ///   up to 50 alphanumeric characters, dashes, and spaces (`^[0-9A-Za-z\s\-]+$`).
35    /// - `app_name`:
36    ///   up to 50 alphanumeric characters and spaces (`^[0-9A-Za-z\s]+$`).
37    pub fn new(tld: &str, author: &str, app_name: &str) -> Option<Self> {
38        if Self::validate_tld(tld)
39            && Self::validate_author(author)
40            && Self::validate_app_name(app_name)
41        {
42            None
43        } else {
44            Some(Self {
45                tld: tld.into(),
46                author: author.into(),
47                app_name: app_name.into(),
48            })
49        }
50    }
51    /// Gets the *Top Level Domain* of the application (e.g. `com` or `io.github`).
52    #[must_use]
53    pub fn tld(&self) -> &str {
54        &self.tld
55    }
56    /// Gets the name of the author of the application.
57    #[must_use]
58    pub fn author(&self) -> &str {
59        &self.author
60    }
61    /// Gets the name of the application.
62    #[must_use]
63    pub fn app_name(&self) -> &str {
64        &self.app_name
65    }
66
67    fn validate_tld(tld: &str) -> bool {
68        !tld.is_empty()
69            && tld.len() <= 127
70            && tld.split('.').all(|label| {
71                !label.is_empty()
72                    && label.len() <= 63
73                    && label.chars().all(|c| c.is_ascii_lowercase() || c.is_ascii_digit())
74            })
75    }
76    fn validate_author(author: &str) -> bool {
77        !author.is_empty()
78            && author.len() <= 50
79            && author.chars().all(|c| c.is_ascii_alphanumeric() || c.is_whitespace() || c == '-')
80    }
81    fn validate_app_name(app_name: &str) -> bool {
82        !app_name.is_empty()
83            && app_name.len() <= 50
84            && app_name.chars().all(|c| c.is_ascii_alphanumeric() || c.is_whitespace())
85    }
86
87    /// Returns an Apple bundle identifier.
88    ///
89    /// This is used in [`AppApple`].
90    #[must_use]
91    pub fn bundle_id(&self) -> String {
92        let author = self.author.to_lowercase().replace(' ', "-");
93        let app_name = self.app_name.replace(' ', "-");
94        let mut parts = vec![self.tld.as_str(), author.as_str(), app_name.as_str()];
95        parts.retain(|part| !part.is_empty());
96        parts.join(".")
97    }
98
99    /// Returns a ‘unixy’ version of the application’s name, akin to what would
100    /// usually be used as a binary name.
101    ///
102    /// Replaces whitespaces with underscores.
103    ///
104    /// This is used in [`AppUnix`] and [`AppXdg`].
105    #[must_use]
106    pub fn unixy_name(&self) -> String {
107        self.app_name.to_lowercase().replace(' ', "_")
108    }
109}
110
111/// Manages directory paths in an environment-aware manner.
112///
113#[doc = crate::_doc!(vendor: "etcetera")]
114#[rustfmt::skip]
115pub trait AppEnv {
116    /// Gets the home directory.
117    #[must_use]
118    fn app_home(&self) -> &Path;
119
120    /// Gets the configuration directory.
121    #[must_use]
122    fn app_config(&self) -> PathBuf;
123
124    /// Gets the data directory.
125    #[must_use]
126    fn app_data(&self) -> PathBuf;
127
128    /// Gets the cache directory.
129    #[must_use]
130    fn app_cache(&self) -> PathBuf;
131
132    /// Gets the state directory.
133    ///
134    /// Currently, only the [`Xdg`](struct.Xdg.html) & [`AppUnix`] environments support this.
135    ///
136    #[must_use]
137    fn app_state(&self) -> Option<PathBuf>;
138
139    /// Gets the runtime directory.
140    ///
141    /// Currently, only the [`Xdg`](struct.Xdg.html) & [`AppUnix`] environments support this.
142    ///
143    /// Note: The [XDG Base Directory Specification][spec] places additional
144    /// requirements on this directory related to ownership, permissions, and
145    /// persistence. This implementation does not check those requirements.
146    ///
147    /// [spec]: https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/latest/
148    #[must_use]
149    fn app_runtime(&self) -> Option<PathBuf>;
150
151    /* provided methods */
152
153    // NOTE: they accept &Path instead of AsRef<OsStr> to be dyn-compatible.
154    // Can be called using .as_ref(), from &str, String, OsStr and OsString.
155
156    /// Constructs a path inside your application’s configuration directory.
157    #[must_use]
158    fn app_in_config(&self, append: &Path) -> PathBuf {
159        app_in(self.app_config(), append)
160    }
161
162    /// Constructs a path inside your application’s data directory.
163    #[must_use]
164    fn app_in_data(&self, append: &Path) -> PathBuf {
165        app_in(self.app_data(), append)
166    }
167
168    /// Constructs a path inside your application’s cache directory.
169    #[must_use]
170    fn app_in_cache(&self, append: &Path) -> PathBuf {
171        app_in(self.app_cache(), append)
172    }
173
174    /// Constructs a path inside your application’s state directory.
175    ///
176    /// Currently, only the [`Xdg`](struct.Xdg.html) & [`AppUnix`] environments support this.
177    #[must_use]
178    fn app_in_state(&self, append: &Path) -> Option<PathBuf> {
179        self.app_state().map(|base| app_in(base, append))
180    }
181
182    /// Constructs a path inside your application’s runtime directory.
183    ///
184    /// Currently, only the [`Xdg`](struct.Xdg.html) & [`AppUnix`] environments support this.
185    #[must_use]
186    fn app_in_runtime(&self, append: &Path) -> Option<PathBuf> {
187        self.app_runtime().map(|base| app_in(base, append))
188    }
189
190    /// Gets the temporary directory.
191    ///
192    /// Uses the system's temporary directory if available. Falls back to
193    /// the application cache directory if the temporary directory is unsuitable.
194    #[must_use]
195    fn app_temp(&self) -> PathBuf {
196        let temp_dir = Env::temp_dir();
197        if temp_dir.is_absolute() {
198            temp_dir
199        } else {
200            self.app_cache()
201        }
202    }
203
204    /// Constructs a path inside the temporary directory.
205    #[must_use]
206    fn app_in_temp(&self, append: &Path) -> PathBuf {
207        app_in(self.app_temp(), append)
208    }
209}
210
211/// Helps construct a path by appending the given `path` to the provided `base` path.
212#[must_use] #[rustfmt::skip]
213fn app_in(mut base: PathBuf, path: &Path) -> PathBuf { base.push(path); base }
214
215/// Xdg enviroment for directories.
216#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
217pub struct AppXdg {
218    home: PathBuf,
219    unixy_name: String,
220}
221impl AppXdg {
222    /// Creates a new Xdg directory environment.
223    ///
224    /// Returns `None` if the home directory cannot be determined (see [`Env::home_dir`]),
225    #[must_use]
226    pub fn new(app_data: Option<AppConfig>) -> Option<Self> {
227        let home = Env::home_dir()?;
228        if let Some(app) = app_data {
229            Some(Self { home, unixy_name: app.unixy_name() })
230        } else {
231            Some(Self { home, unixy_name: String::new() })
232        }
233    }
234    // Returns `None` if the path obtained from the env var isn’t absolute.
235    fn env_var_or_none(env_var: &str) -> Option<PathBuf> {
236        Env::var_os(env_var).and_then(|path| {
237            let path = PathBuf::from(path);
238            path.is_absolute().then_some(path)
239        })
240    }
241    fn env_var_or_default(&self, env_var: &str, default: impl AsRef<Path>) -> PathBuf {
242        Self::env_var_or_none(env_var).unwrap_or_else(|| self.home.join(default))
243    }
244}
245impl AppEnv for AppXdg {
246    fn app_home(&self) -> &Path {
247        &self.home
248    }
249    fn app_config(&self) -> PathBuf {
250        let dir = self.env_var_or_default("XDG_CONFIG_HOME", ".config/");
251        is![self.unixy_name.is_empty(); dir; dir.join(&self.unixy_name)]
252    }
253    fn app_data(&self) -> PathBuf {
254        let dir = self.env_var_or_default("XDG_DATA_HOME", ".local/share/");
255        is![self.unixy_name.is_empty(); dir; dir.join(&self.unixy_name)]
256    }
257    fn app_cache(&self) -> PathBuf {
258        let dir = self.env_var_or_default("XDG_CACHE_HOME", ".cache/");
259        is![self.unixy_name.is_empty(); dir; dir.join(&self.unixy_name)]
260    }
261    fn app_state(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> {
262        let dir = self.env_var_or_default("XDG_STATE_HOME", ".local/state/");
263        Some(is![self.unixy_name.is_empty(); dir; dir.join(&self.unixy_name)])
264    }
265    fn app_runtime(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> {
266        let dir = Self::env_var_or_none("XDG_RUNTIME_DIR");
267        is![self.unixy_name.is_empty(); dir; dir.map(|d| d.join(&self.unixy_name))]
268    }
269}
270
271/// Unix enviroment for directories.
272///
273/// This constructs directories specific to an application using
274/// its `unixy_name`, which is derived from the application's name.
275///
276/// This is no standard or official specification, but an old convention of
277/// placing the configuration directory under the user's home directory.
278///
279/// Vim and Cargo are notable examples whose configuration/data/cache directory
280/// layouts are similar to these.
281#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
282pub struct AppUnix {
283    home: PathBuf,
284    unixy_name: String,
285}
286impl AppUnix {
287    /// Creates a new Unix directory environment.
288    ///
289    /// Returns `None` if the home directory cannot be determined (see [`Env::home_dir`]),
290    #[must_use]
291    pub fn new(app_data: AppConfig) -> Option<Self> {
292        let home = Env::home_dir()?;
293        Some(Self { home, unixy_name: app_data.unixy_name() })
294    }
295}
296#[rustfmt::skip]
297impl AppEnv for AppUnix {
298    fn app_home(&self) -> &Path { &self.home }
299    fn app_config(&self) -> PathBuf { self.home.join(&self.unixy_name) }
300    fn app_data(&self) -> PathBuf { self.app_config().join("data") }
301    fn app_cache(&self) -> PathBuf { self.app_config().join("cache") }
302    fn app_state(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> { Some(self.app_config().join("state")) }
303    fn app_runtime(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> { Some(self.app_config().join("runtime")) }
304}
305
306/// Apple enviroment for directories.
307#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
308pub struct AppApple {
309    home: PathBuf,
310    bundle_id: String,
311}
312impl AppApple {
313    /// Creates a new Apple directory environment.
314    ///
315    /// Returns `None` if the home directory cannot be determined (see [`Env::home_dir`]),
316    #[must_use]
317    pub fn new(app_data: Option<AppConfig>) -> Option<Self> {
318        let home = Env::home_dir()?;
319        if let Some(app) = app_data {
320            Some(Self { home, bundle_id: app.bundle_id() })
321        } else {
322            Some(Self { home, bundle_id: String::new() })
323        }
324    }
325}
326#[rustfmt::skip]
327impl AppEnv for AppApple {
328    fn app_home(&self) -> &Path { &self.home }
329    fn app_config(&self) -> PathBuf {
330        let dir = self.home.join("Library/Preferences/");
331        is![self.bundle_id.is_empty(); dir; dir.join(&self.bundle_id)]
332    }
333    fn app_data(&self) -> PathBuf {
334        let dir = self.home.join("Library/Application Support/");
335        is![self.bundle_id.is_empty(); dir; dir.join(&self.bundle_id)]
336    }
337    fn app_cache(&self) -> PathBuf {
338        let dir = self.home.join("Library/Caches/");
339        is![self.bundle_id.is_empty(); dir; dir.join(&self.bundle_id)]
340    }
341    fn app_state(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> { None }
342    fn app_runtime(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> { None }
343}
344
345/// Windows enviroment for directories.
346#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
347pub struct AppWindows {
348    home: PathBuf,
349    app_path: Option<PathBuf>,
350}
351impl AppWindows {
352    /// Creates a new Windows directory environment.
353    ///
354    /// Returns `None` if the home directory cannot be determined (see [`Env::home_dir`]),
355    #[must_use] #[rustfmt::skip]
356    pub fn new(app_data: Option<AppConfig>) -> Option<Self> {
357        let home = Env::home_dir()?;
358        if let Some(app) = app_data {
359            Some(Self { home, app_path: Some(PathBuf::from(app.author).join(app.app_name)) })
360        } else {
361            Some(Self { home, app_path: None })
362        }
363    }
364}
365#[rustfmt::skip]
366impl AppEnv for AppWindows {
367    fn app_home(&self) -> &Path { &self.home }
368    fn app_config(&self) -> PathBuf {
369        let mut dir = self.home.join("AppData").join("Roaming");
370        is![let Some(app) = &self.app_path; {dir.push(app); dir.push("config"); dir }; dir]
371    }
372    fn app_data(&self) -> PathBuf {
373        let mut dir = self.home.join("AppData").join("Roaming");
374        is![let Some(app) = &self.app_path; {dir.push(app); dir.push("data"); dir }; dir]
375    }
376    fn app_cache(&self) -> PathBuf {
377        let mut dir = self.home.join("AppData").join("Local");
378        is![let Some(app) = &self.app_path; {dir.push(app); dir.push("cache"); dir }; dir]
379    }
380    fn app_state(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> { None }
381    fn app_runtime(&self) -> Option<PathBuf> { None }
382}
